publication.title: Efficient SAT Techniques for Relative Encoding of Permutations with Constraints
publication.jconf: Australian Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence

publication.title: Comparison of Boolean Satisfiability Encodings on FPGA Detailed Routing Problems
publication.jconf: Design, Automation, and Test in Europe

publication.title: Efficient SAT-based techniques for Design of Experiments by using static variable ordering
publication.jconf: International Symposium on Quality Electronic Design

publication.title: Efficient SAT Techniques for Absolute Encoding of Permutation Problems: Application to Hamiltonian Cycles
publication.jconf: Symposium on Abstraction, Reformulation and Approximation
publication.abstract: We study novel approaches for solving of hard combina- torial problems by translation to Boolean Satisfiability (SAT). Our focus is on combinatorial problems that can be represented as a permutation of n objects, subject to additional constraints. In the case of the Hamiltonian Cycle Problem (HCP), these constraints are that two adja- cent nodes in a permutation should also be
